Posts.Title: Nosebleeds with taxol marial scuttlers

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2011 03:12PM marial wrote: Waiting is the worst! I also live in No Ca and go to a large HMO..I felt the lump on the weekend of Dec 9th..saw my OB at 9am that Monday..had N ultrasound at 1pm that day followed by mammo, then biopsy the next morning at 8am..met with BS at 930 the next day, Wed..And had my mast the following Tues!..was shocked it went so fast especially the week before Christmas..but was happy it did
Posts.Title: Would you wait 2-3 weeks for a biopsy? Beanpole DocBabs

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2011 07:56AM marial wrote: I was diagnosed on a Wed,and had my surgery the coloring Tues. I have a 14 year old daughter..I could not talk to anyone at first without losing it..I had a couple family members talk to her so she had some idea what was going on..of course at that point, we did not know the chemo ahead etc, so we had to discuss things as it went along. Luckily, we had friends who offered to take her to and from school, etc that helped a lot. I also sent an email to her counselor at school to let them know in case anything happened with her at school..the counsler has called her in a few times to check in with her to see how she is doing.. I really have tried to make life seem as normal as possible for her,and luckily I was never too sick or weak..But I did talk to her about me losing my hair, etc..which she handled well..I wish you all the best
Posts.Title: how do I tell my kids spunkyboobster Miller1353

Yeah Cyborg! Thanks for the replies on my wig question everyone!
